author: @zazoomblog
title: La biopasta e i cerotti green salva-coralli
text:
La biopasta e i cerotti green salva-coralli
Una biopasta per salvare e restaurare i coralli. E un cerotto naturale per curarli. Sono le ultime invenzioni studiate dai ricercatori del Marhe Center - il centro studi dell√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ Universit√É di Milano-Bicocca alle Maldive - insieme all√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia e all√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢Acquario di Genova. Il nuovo materiale brevettato si chiama √¢‚Ç¨≈ì Active Biopaste √¢‚Ç¨ÔøΩ, √É¬® una pasta a base di olio di soia modificato e grafene che, una volta mescolata, indurisce ancorando i coralli e accelerandone la crescita grazie alla tecnologia della mineralizzazione elettrochimica. "Ci√É¬≤ che rende unica la nostra soluzione √É¬® l√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢integrazione di due funzioni fondamentali in un solo materiale innovativo √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú spiega Gabriele Corigliano, primo autore dello studio e dottorando in Scienze Marine alla Bicocca e nell√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢unit√É Smart Materials √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú.
[üîó Leggi su Ilgiorno.it]
In questa notizia si parla di: coralli - biopasta - cerotti - green

author: VideoElephant
title: Millions of U.S. workers will see a pay increase in 2024
text: At the start of the new year, 22 states and 43 cities and counties are increasing the hourly minimum wage, benefiting nearly 10 million people. author: Pat Ashworth
title: London vicar ‚Äòhangs on to hope‚Äô after arson at Palmers Green
text:
St John the Evangelist, Palmers Green, was set on fire on New Year‚Äôs Day
FORENSICS have confirmed that arson caused the fire that extensively damaged St John the Evangelist, Palmers Green, in north London, on New Year‚Äôs Day. The police are also investigating a seven-month campaign of misogyny and hate crime directed at the Vicar, the Revd Julie Coleman. A person has been escorted from the church on several occasions.
The church is known for its community outreach, notably its foodbank and the work with refugees that it runs from The Ark, in its parish centre (News, 5 November 2021). Ms Coleman says that she implemented a ‚Äúzero-tolerance‚Äù approach to the anti-social behaviour that was rife in the area when she arrived three years ago, and works closely with the local council and police to build relationships.
The fire, started by the high altar, damaged stained-glass windows and artefacts, was hot enough to melt the candles, and had been nurtured like a barbecue, forensics found. Police told Ms Coleman that, had she gone into the church when it was ablaze, she would have been asphyxiated. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs sad is that it was started in the most sacred part of the church,‚Äù she told the Church Times last week.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hanging on to hope at the moment: it might only be tiny sparks of hope, but the encouragement we‚Äôve had has given us the strength to dust ourselves off from the haters and to keep going while praying for peace in the world we‚Äôre all part of.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm aware that people are fighting through their own personal protective challenges after the fire; others have had to cancel things like weddings and baptisms. We‚Äôre working really closely with our architects and with Ecclesiastical Insurance and our builders. The Bishop of London has been great, coming out to see me and my children; and the police and fire services have been so supportive.‚Äù
The church is likely to be closed for six months, while work and worship are transferred to the parish centre and The Ark. Ms Coleman has received support from other faiths and denominations: Muslim women from Afghanistan have made her a new chasuble to replace the one damaged by smoke; and a Roman Catholic priest has brought her new altar linen. Others have ensured that the family has groceries and hot meals.
‚ÄúRefugees know what it is to have pain. It gives us a common denominator, a bond. People who have been war-torn are now supporting me. I haven‚Äôt experienced as much hate as they have, but I‚Äôve been on the receiving end of it,‚Äù she said.
Adversity brings resilience, but misogyny in the church and community isn‚Äôt talked about enough, she concludes. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm shocked that there isn‚Äôt support in the Church, and I‚Äôm hoping this draws awareness to it. I believe we can grow from this challenge.‚Äù

author: Justino Xiu Chan
title: Accidente en FCP: J√≥venes en motocicleta terminan estrell√°ndose contra un taxi - PorEsto
text:
Dos j√≥venes que circulaban a bordo de una motocicleta a una velocidad inmoderada y al no respetar un se√±alamiento de transito que les indicaba hacer su alto total, terminaron estrell√°ndose en contra de un taxi que circulaba sobre la v√≠a principal. En este accidente, resulto uno de los ocupantes, con posible fractura en una de sus extremidades inferiores, por lo que fuero de recibir los primeros auxilios, fue trasladado al hospital general para su atenci√≥n m√©dica.
Los hechos se registraron en la avenida Santiago Pacheco Cruz, por la calle 88 de la colonia Francisco May, cuando fue reportado a trav√©s del n√∫mero de emergencia de un accidente vial en la que se vieron involucrados dos j√≥venes que circulaban en una motocicleta, que terminaron estrell√°ndose en contra de un taxi.
Al lugar los primeros en hacer acto de presencia, fueron los elementos de la Direcci√≥n de Transito Municipal, quienes se encargaron de realizar los trabajos periciales, y solicitar el apoyo de una ambulancia, debido a que uno de los dos j√≥venes que iban a bordo de la motocicleta, presentaba serias lesiones adem√°s de una posible fractura en una de las extremidades inferiores.
Por lo que al sitio arrib√≥ una ambulancia de la Cruz Roja, delegaci√≥n Felipe Carrillo Puerto, cuyos param√©dicos procedieron a brindarle los primeros auxilios, para luego ser abordado en la unidad de rescate, para que sea trasladada al hospital general para su atenci√≥n m√©dica.
Los dos j√≥venes circulaba a bordo de una motocicleta, marca Italika, color azul con blanco, y placas de circulaci√≥n 62UPS5 de Quintana Roo, mismo que circulaba de oriente a poniente y que el operador al no respectar un se√±alamiento de transito que le marcaba hacer alto total, sigui√≥ de largo para estrellarse en contra de un taxi, perteneciente al sindicato de Taxistas General Francisco May.
El segundo veh√≠culo se trata de la marca Chevrolet, tipo Beat, color blanco, con franjas negras, con n¬¥pumero econ√≥mico 157, y placas de circulaci√≥n B-236-TMD del servicio local, mismo que circulaba sobre la calle 88 de norte a sur. Del impacto la unidad quedo destrozado el vertice frontal izquierdo, mientras que los j√≥venes, salieron proyectados en el aire para caer sobre el duro pavimento.

author: MarketScreener
title: Merck's Posts More Positive Clesrovimab RSV Candidate Study Data - MarketScreener
text:
By Colin Kellaher
Merck & Co. on Thursday reported further positive results from a late-stage study of its proposed clesrovimab vaccine aimed at protecting infants from respiratory syncytial virus, or RSV, disease.
Merck said the Phase 2b/3 pivotal study evaluating a single dose of clesrovimab administered to healthy preterm and full-term infants met all prespecified endpoints, with consistent results through both the five-month and six-month time points.
The Rahway, N.J., drugmaker said clesrovimab reduced the incidence of RSV-associated medically attended lower respiratory infections as well as RSV-associated hospitalizations.
RSV, a contagious virus that is the leading cause of hospitalization for healthy infants, can cause inflammation in the airways, leading to difficulty breathing.
Merck in July reported that the study had met its primary safety and efficacy through 150 days.
Merck said clesrovimab has the potential to become the first and only approved immunization designed to protect infants with the same single dose regardless of weight for the duration of their first RSV season. The company said it aims to make clesrovimab available for infants as early as the 2025-26 RSV season.
Write to Colin Kellaher at colin.kellaher@wsj.com
(END) Dow Jones Newswires
10-17-24 1814ET

author: Bernews8
title: BHB: Sterile Processing Dept To Be Upgraded
text: BHB: Sterile Processing Dept To Be Upgraded The Bermuda Hospitals Board today announced that it is ‚Äústarting a major renovation project for its sterile processing department that will run from February to July 2025.‚Äù A spokesperson said, ‚ÄúSterile processing is the sanitisation of equipment and items used in clinical care. The highly specialised cleaning process ensures items are completely safe for use. All surgical tools are cleaned and packaged in this area to support the over 9,000 surgeries undertaken at KEMH per year. Any items that are re-used across the hospitals are also processed through this department.‚Äù Chief Operating Officer Preston Swan comments: ‚ÄúThis is a long overdue upgrade project that will remedy the issues that have impacted SPD over the last few years, such as equipment failure and floods. The equipment is over 14 years old and the area is in the older part of the General Wing so the infrastructure is in urgent need of work. A failure in SPD could impact our ability to deliver life saving procedures and deliver safe care across our inpatient and outpatient service. This is a priority project for us that will enable us to deliver the safest, most efficient sterile processing service in the support of patient care.‚Äù The spokesperson said, ‚ÄúThe project will cost about $4.5 million in total and will include the replacement of equipment, furniture and the floor as well as an upgrade of the infrastructure.‚Äù Mr Swan continues: ‚ÄúWe anticipate the upgrade work in SPD will start in February and be completed by July 2025. While the department is upgraded, we will use a temporary sterile processing area that is currently being constructed in the old surgical area of the General Wing, just opposite the existing location. ‚ÄúThe capacity of the temporary area will be enough to meet most of our needs during the upgrade, but there will be some patient impact. We anticipate there will be a reduction in the number of major elective surgeries undertaken in any one day, such as hips and knee replacements, as these are very instrument intensive. I would stress, however, that we will be able to complete all emergency and time-sensitive surgical needs, for example trauma, emergency caesarians or cancer surgeries, and there will be less impact on procedures that don‚Äôt need much instrumentation, such as pain management, some cardiology procedures, endoscopy and urology procedures.‚Äù The spokesperson said, ‚ÄúOnce complete, the upgrade will ensure a much more consistent sterile processing service, optimising safety, quality and efficiency.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe apologise that there will likely be fewer major elective surgeries during the first half of year,‚Äù Mr Swan says. ‚ÄúWe will continue to do all we can to minimise the patient impact across all our services. Certainly the upgrade of this critical area is required to ensure that the sterile processing service is as robust and efficient as possible to meet the long term needs of Bermuda patients for the years ahead.‚Äù

author: Collins Nnabuife
title: Anglican Primate tasks media practitioners on patriotism
text:
The Primate of the Church of Nigeria (Anglican Communion) Archbishop Henry Ndukuba has charged practitioners in media and entertainment industry to project Nigeria in good light.
Archbishop Ndukuba who made the call while parleying with the media in his residence, enumerated the need to emulate practitioners who portray tourism and investment potentials of their countries in movies and in the news.
The religious leader said most practitioners in Nigeria project things that do not speak well of the country and do not attract foreign investment.
He said rather than engaging in things that we bring those bad names, the press should always present Nigeria in a good light.
‚ÄúI think that the journalism of the pre-independence I believe, is the type of journalism we need now to redeem the image of our country.
‚ÄúGo for the things that we make for the building up and unity and progress and prosperity of our nation,‚Äù he said.
Furthermore, the Clergyman acknowledged that the celebration of the 2023 Christmas is being done in the context of much anxiety, stress, and challenges.
He, however, observed that the prices of commodities are so high including the cost of transport saying that ordinary things that were hitherto, easily affordable are gradually getting out of the reach of the common man.
The Anglican primate expressed displeasure over the security situation in the country, as he also expressed concern over bad roads in the country and the state of infrastructure in general that we have.
He expressed hope in President Bola Tinubu‚Äôs administration saying that with the 2024 budget being considered by the National Assembly, there is hope for the country.
Archbishop Ndukuba warned against ‚Äúweaponisation of religious identity‚Äù which he said is responsible for the inclusion or exclusion of some sections of the country.
According to him, weaponisation of religious identity leads to attacks, discrimination, to subdue and to control people.
‚ÄúAs the scripture says, perfect love casts out fear. If the love of God is shared among us as human persons, I believe God that I will treat my brother or my sister no matter where he or she is coming from with respect and with love; love is to seek the best be done for him or her.
‚ÄúAnd if there is anything, especially in our country in this season of lack, in this time of stress, is the need for us to care for one another, bear one another‚Äôs burden, and help each other both as citizens and as leaders, whether religious or political in all our communities.
‚ÄúLet us pursue the things that make for peace, because we are celebrating the best of the Prince of Peace for He has come to reconcile us with one another and with God and to make peace reign on earth,‚Äù he said.
READ ALSO FROM
 NIGERIAN TRIBUNE

author: Redazione
title: Newcoop di Carini, stato di agitazione. L‚Äôassemblea dei lavoratori con Filt e Cgil vara pacchetto di 24 ore di sciopero. Luned√¨ il presidio
text:
Palermo 12 settembre 2024 ‚Äì Stato di agitazione alla Newcoop Don Milani, azienda di Carini che gestisce la logistica per Conad.
A proclamarlo, a far data da domani, con interruzione dello straordinario e del lavoro nei festivi, l‚Äôassemblea dei lavoratori, riunita per discutere di argomenti come la salute e la sicurezza, l‚Äôorganizzazione del lavoro, il licenziamento scattato ad agosto nei confronti di un lavoratore, rappresentante della Filt Cgil Palermo, e le sanzioni nei confronti di altri 5 lavoratori.
L‚Äôassemblea, molto partecipata, ha unitariamente varato un pacchetto di 24 ore di sciopero. Le prime 8 ore per turno si terranno luned√¨ mattina, con un presidio ai cancelli dalle 6 alle 13.
La vertenza, che va avanti dall‚Äôinizio di agosto, √® stata seguita dal segretario generale Filt Cgil Palermo Fabio lo Monaco. Oggi all‚Äôassemblea hanno preso parte anche il segretario generale Cgil Palermo Mario Ridulfo e il segretario generale Filt Cgil Sicilia Alessandro Grasso.
Le prime crepe nei rapporti tra l‚Äôazienda e i lavoratori si sono aperte dopo la richiesta ai lavoratori di effettuare ulteriori turni aggiuntivi di lavoro. I lavoratori, gi√† provati dalle alte temperature di lavoro nei capannoni aziendali durante il periodo estivo, hanno posto dei problemi di tutela in ordine alla loro salute e alla sicurezza. Di questo tenore le obiezioni poste dall‚Äô Rsa della Filt Cgil Palermo. Per tutta risposta, l‚Äôazienda ha contestato un atteggiamento aggressivo da parte del rappresentante sindacale della Filt nei confronti del datore di lavoro. E ha licenziato il lavoratore. Oltre al licenziamento dell‚Äôrsa, in 5 sono stati sospesi per un giorno. A un altro lavoratore √® stato contestato un quarto d‚Äôora ritardo.
Filt Cgil e Cgil Palermo hanno inizialmente provato a ricucire il rapporto con la Newcoop, associata a Legacoop, chiedendo il ritiro del licenziamento del delegato aziendale, intervenuto a nome dei 200 lavoratori. Luned√¨ scorso il tentativo di mediazione pacifico si era conclusa con la valutazione della possibilit√† di ritirare la sospensione, per ripristinare le relazioni sindacali. Il sindacato si era impegnato a non proseguire con azioni di sciopero manifestando comunque la volont√† di impugnare in ogni caso il provvedimento, in linea con il diritto del lavoratore licenziato. La trattativa, che sembrava a un passo dalla conclusione, √® invece proseguita con la richiesta al sindacato di non procedere con l‚Äôimpugnativa, e con la richiesta di scuse da parte del lavoratore.
A questo punto √® arrivato il no da parte della Cgil, che pi√π volte aveva chiesto in questi mesi all‚Äôazienda di discutere di sicurezza sul lavoro, ottenendo in cambio solo silenzio.
 ‚ÄúL‚Äôobiettivo della nostra iniziativa √® il ritiro dei provvedimenti disciplinari col reintegro del lavoratore licenziato, condizione per il ripristino di corrette relazioni sindacali ‚Äì dichiarano per la Filt Cgil Palermo il segretario generale Fabio Lo Monaco e il segretario Domenico Seminara e per la Cgil Palermo il segretario generale Mario Ridulfo e il segretario Dario Fazzese ‚Äì Chiediamo all‚Äôazienda di tornare sui propri passi e di ritirare i provvedimenti, al fine di riaprire un confronto sindacale. Se l‚Äôazienda pensa di essersi liberata da questo lavoratore, sappia che continuer√† a svolgere attivit√† sindacale sia dentro che fuori l‚Äôazienda‚Äù.

author: Anthony Robledo
title: Viral photo of forlorn Spiral Hot Dogs owner leads to booming business
text: Customer's photo of forlorn owner in empty restaurant leads business to boom at OK diner Nick Chappell had never been to Spirals Hot Dogs & More before he took a photo of Scott Hosek in his empty restaurant. But after business boomed, Chappell's part of the Spirals family, Hosek says. [Anthony Robledo](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7612431001/anthony-robledo/) An Oklahoma hot dog joint owner visibly wanted customers one day and he soon got more than he bargained for. During a slow shift on Dec. 20, a customer took a photo of Scott Hosek standing by his restaurant entrance waiting for diners and shared it on social media. Hosek would soon have no time to stand around as " [Spirals: Hot Dogs & More](https://spiralshotdogs.com/)," in Norman, Oklahoma, saw booming business once the post went viral. "We immediately started doing double digits in sales," Hosek told USA TODAY on Thursday. "It happened really fast to me." The day the photo was taken, Hosek found himself staring out the window upset his family business of four years wasn't booming as well as others ahead of Christmas. Hosek said he had no idea why Spirals saw a sudden wave of new customers after Dec. 20 until the person responsible for posting the photo, Nick Chappell, later apologized and offered to take the post down. Hosek wouldn't hear of it. "You just wouldn't expect it. Social media is amazing. It's amazing that people get involved with it," he said. "But more importantly, it's the stuff that you just don't think would work. That's what works." 'I will always love you': [See Dolly Parton grant Utah man's dying wish to meet her](/story/life/humankind/2023/12/26/dolly-parton-meets-longtime-fan/72033945007/) Customer knew he had to capture 'wholesome moment' Chappell visited the Norman area for his job as an Oklahoma Army National Guard. As part of their weekly hot dog Wednesday routine, Chappell and a his co-worker found Spirals on Google Maps and took a chance. Noticing Hosek gazing, Chappell decided to capture the "wholesome moment" on Snapchat captioning "He has been standing here waiting on customers to come in." "A good buddy of mine named Chad said, 'Hey, man, you can either post this on Facebook or I'm going to post this on Facebook. Some way or another we're going to get this guy some customers,'" Chappell said. In a Facebook post, Chappell gave an excellent recommendation of the restaurant, complimenting their food and "off the charts" service. He shared a photo of his dish, the menu and of Hosek waiting for diners. Chappell was blown away by the success of the post, which has since had over 2,000 shares, and even more surprised to see over 70 guests at the diner during his next visit. "I'm not a huge social media guy I typically don't share," Chappell said. "I don't even know really the words to describe it as but it made me even that much happier that I did make a post." Owner adds new 'Thunderbird' item in customer's honor Hosek is showing his gratitude by adding a new item in Chappell's honor. Having named hot dogs and bowls after family members, he was more than happy to do so. The "Thunderbird" is a hot link with bacon, cream cheese and jalape√±os, Hosek said. The meal gets its name from the Thunderbird Unit Patch for the 45th Infantry, which Chappell is a part of. The two reconnected at the restaurant on Thursday, where they both got emotional talking about the post's impact. Chappell received a certificate of appreciation during the unveiling of the "Thunderbird" and was told he is now forever part of the Spirals family. "To know that it was a humble guy that just saw our need and did what he could. He doesn‚Äôt have a real following on social media, he hardly ever shares anything and to know that one post had so much power. It was super cool," Hosek added.
